Text.Value: Perhaps Lord Gortash will revive that grand tradition.
I don't care if the lad threw a bloody boulder at you - that's out of line!
You can go when I'm through with you, little brat.
Just a pebble? A pebble could take out an eye, break a tooth, enter an open mouth and block a gullet.
Is that what you wish? Do you wish to choke me to death? Perhaps loot my purse after?
Is this what the city is coming to? A man cannot stroll the thoroughfare without being assaulted by juvenile thugs?
Gutter-filth. And I suppose your mother squeezed out a whole litter just like you. Filling the damn city to the brim like a slop-bucket.
My shop's pilfered from every day by runts like him. City should be for proper folk, who earn their crust.
And what do you propose? Just let him run amuck, no lesson heeded?
You will be. Once order is restored.

EditorData.NodeContext: relishing it a little too much

Text.Value: Why are you here, anyway?
No, he works. At the docks.
You're just the sort that Lord Gortash warns us of. Just the sort he'll deal with.
I said I'm sorry. Can I go now?

EditorData.NodeContext: Sticking up for himself a little more

Text.Value: Precisely the attitude that is ruining this city! No pride! No discipline! No consequences!
Don't you have nothing else to do but browbeat this boy?
I doubt he has a father to discipline him - probably dead in an alley or drunk in a tavern.
I'm sorry...
You've had your say, now clear off. Go back to the Upper City.
Hear, hear.

EditorData.NodeContext: Voicing support for a nobleman giving a street kid a dressing-down

Text.Value: It was just a pebble.
Ease up, won't you? It was just a tiny stone bounced off your rump, not a ballista bolt.
I am a gentleman who may venture where he pleases - it is you who must mind where they go, and do not forget it!
Oh, I'm sure. Gutting fish, is he? Or perhaps he works the street corner? Nothing would surprise me with your kind.
There was a time when we'd have a pillory in the Wide, small enough even for street pups like you.
I won't do it again, I swear.
'Hear, hear'? Surely you can't agree with how he's talking to a child? It's out of order!

Synopsis: A rich twat from the upper city is making a child's prank an act of active betrayal against the spirit of the city.  The people around him are mostly unimpressed.
